text: Running into a weird issue in a client Design Manager... search is only returning a maximum of 25 results for each query, even when there are more assets that should match. Trying to update all in-use footer global modules, but between various themes in this portal, there are probably 30+ modules, partials, and global groups with "footer" in the name.
Clear your local storage and try again.
i dont think ive got that issue n any of my portals… mainly due to not having that many files named the same
question… how many headers, footers and pages does it take to make a website… exactly?
again, it's all assets, custom modules, global groups, global modules, template partials, page/email variants that has footer in the name for some reason. Only maybe 5 are being used... /shrug

<@U26BLKGE4> I’ve been able to reproduce the issue and I’ve filed an issue for it.

In the short term I would recommend using the CMS CLI to download all of the folders you think could contain a “footer”  - you could download the root. Then you can use local tools like VS Code to search across several files at once

I have a product that integrates with other CRMs. Most CRM softwares have a concept of "tagging". HubSpot does not have tags, (so far as I found), so if I want to apply a tag to a contact in another platform, what would the same type of action be in HubSpot?

Would I simply add the contact to a list?
Could do a list, or you could set up a contact property. A multi-select choice field would probably make the most sense, so you can manage the tags from a single source.
